results.title: Crocodile Dundee II. (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: John Cornell, Jane Scott and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Begins in New York where Dundee now lives with his journalist girlfriend. In order to escape the pursuit of an international drug ring who have murdered her former husband, Dundee and his girlfriend return to the Australian outback where Dundee is well prepared to confront them.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Peter Fairman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter (Paul Hogan) and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan, where his very outback Australian approach to the dangers of a big city, make him a success in New York society.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter, Mick ‘Crocodile’ Dundee, and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. Stars Paul Hogan and Linda Kozlowski.

results.title: Crocodile
results.creator_credit: Peter Du Cane and David Moore
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Fauna”.
The hot tropical coast and hinterland of northern Australia support two types of crocodile with very different habitats and lifestyles. The program explores the life of the Salt Water Crocodile which inhabits estuaries and mangroves. In contrast, Johnstone’s Freshwater Crocodile, a shy animal, lives inland in seasonal rivers.

results.title: Crocodile
results.creator_credit: John Shaw, Christopher Parsons, Don Murray, British Broadcasting Corporation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The World about us”.
A comprehensive treatment of saltwater and freshwater crocodiles. A ‘non-specialist’ film, it is nevertheless scientifically accurate, and takes a balanced view of this little understood and seldom loved reptile, which is now in danger of extinction. Narrated by Hugh Falkus. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Criticus
results.brief_description: A satirical look at the eternal triangle of the art world - the artist, the audience and the critic. The arrogance of Criticus, the critic, infuriates both the musician and his audience, and a friend of the performer decides to get rid of the nuisance. However, it is not as easy as he thinks.

results.title: Critical thinking: making sure of facts
results.creator_credit: Dick Larson and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Timely topics dealing with reading, listening and television viewing help demonstrate how to evaluate the facts about a particular situation. This involves knowing whether information is based on an eye-witness or secondary account, checking the sources of information, and assessing the skills and knowledge of the source.

results.title: Critical path in use
results.creator_credit: Sam Napier-Bell and British Productivity Council
results.brief_description: In planning a new undertaking, a chart is made to show each move as a separate step in an integral plan. This technique helps to solve many problems on paper before they occur in practice. Shows the drawing up after discussion of a Critical Path Analysis for work on a major project. The advantages of the system for all units are emphasised, and reference is made to the British export effort.

results.title: Critical path
results.creator_credit: Peter De Normanville and British Information Services
results.brief_description: Uses the construction of a service station to illustrate the critical path method of planning and scheduling, in which a project is broken down into distinct operations, the time for completion of each estimated, and the longest irreduceable sequence of operations calculated. Consecutive and concurrent operations are identified and the most efficient use of working time planned.
